titleStmt.title: National Library of Sweden, A 67
titleStmt.sponsor: Medieval Latin Manuscripts in the National Library: Cataloguing and Digitization
titleStmt.funder: Riksbankens jubileumsfond – The Swedish Foundation for Humanities and Social Sciences

publicationStmt.publisher: manuscripta.se: A Digital Catalogue of Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts in Sweden

msDesc.head: Birger Gregersson, Officium S. Birgittae. St. Birgitta, Sermo angelicus and Revelationes I-VIII

collation.formula: 1(2), 2(8, leaf missing at the end), 3-14(12), 15(12, 4 leaves missing at the end)

p.note: Note by German owner in black ink: D. Gustav Klemm, Dresden 18 Febr. 1837. Next to it a note by the Swedish librarian Klemming: Köpt till Kongl Bibliotheket Okt 1873 för 44 på auktion i Dresden ankom den 23/10 Gustav Klemming.

Addition by medieval hand in black ink: 1429 ipso die s. Clementis frater Kuch insinuavit processum contra M.W. in valvis ecclesie sancti Severi Erfordensis super executione condempnacionis 85 florenum de camera etc.

binding.p: Tawed skin on wooden boards. Possibly originally painted in brown, now very torn. Holes after missing bosses in the centre and at the corners of the front and back cover. Two metal plates at the fore-edge of the back cover with fragments of straps passing to upper cover; inside the front cover remains of strap and pin fastenings (two small metal pieces nailed with two nails). Five double spinebands and two endbands. Binding repaired.

Text and labels on front cover: Top edge and almost illegible, Revelaciones (?) (tooled); beneath: a fragment of a shelfmark label of paper written in brown ink near top edge upper cover (text possibly C XXI; cf Lehmann (1936)
; towards the centre of the board a barely leggible tooled shelfmark: C XXX (?), partially covered by a paper label. Bottom edge, left corner: paper label with current signum. Spine: paper labels on first, third, fourth and fifth compartments of the spine: 1. Revelacones (sic!) S. Brigittae MS. 1424, (written by the same hand as the title and inscription on ); 2. dark and almost illegible: Revela[ciones] S. Birgitte (?); 3. illegible; 4. 57.
The pastedowns consist of two 13th c. bifolia containing commentary on the titles of the Decretales Gregorii IX; : on Extra 1,38-2,7; 3,21-27; : on Extra 1,8-22; 2,30-3,7.

history.origin:
Germany
1424. Monastery of Saint Peter and Paul (Peterskloster, OSB), Erfurt. According to the colophon on finished on 18th August, 1424. Listed in the monastery’s library catalogue of 1783: De Gotha Joa.: Revelationes approbatae S. Brigittae as no. 57, (cf 57 on the spine), see Theele (1920)
(the manuscript is not identified by him); also listed in Krämer (1989)
.
history.provenance: Belonged to Friedrich Gottlieb Julius von Bülow zu Beyernamburg (1760-1831). The manuscript was bought by von Bülow around 1803 after the secularization of the monastery.
The manuscript was bought by Gustav Klemm (1802-1867), anthropologist and librarian of the royal library at Dresden at the sale of the Bibliotheca Büloviana in 1836. His signature is found on .
On an inscription by Georg Heinrich Schäffer, who prepared the catalogue for sale of the library of von Bülow 10 October 1836.
history.acquisition: Bought by the National Library in 1873 at an auction in Dresden, cf. note on .

msItem.title: Alphabetical table of contents to the Revelations A-X
msItem.rubric: Incipit registrum super libros reuelacionum sancte Brigitte

msItem.title: Canonization Bull by Boniface IX, 7 October 1391
msItem.rubric: Epistula Bonifacii pape noni de presenti libro reuelacionum beate Brigitte
msItem.incipit: BOnifatius - seruus seruorum dei Venerabilibus fratribus
msItem.explicit: Datum rome apud sanctum petrum Nonas octobris pontificatus nostri anno secundo -
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit epistula bonifacii pape noni in presentem librum reuelacionum beatissme brigitte vidue

msItem.title: Officium Sancte Birgitte
msItem.rubric: Officium Sancte Brigitte antiphona ad uesperas super psalmum
msItem.incipit: prima antiphona ad primas vesperas. Brigitte matris inclite festa iocunda suscipe
msItem.explicit: Vt hostem se- non uideam m- et in eu- Amen solamen sis Brigitta singula Amen

msItem.title: Sermo angelicus
msItem.rubric: Cum beta brigitta sollicitaretur pro leccionibus matutinalibus monialium magni monasterii quod ipsa ad iussum domini de facultatibus suis astruxerit? cuius regulam ipse dominus ihesus dictauerat ob honorem beate marie matris sue misit? ei dominus angelum dictantem sequentes lecciones per anni circulum pertinendas quas ipsa ex eius ore conscripsit ut-?
msItem.incipit: Cum beata Brigitta principissa regni suecie quia? plures annos habitaret in roma in domo cardinalatus
msItem.explicit: Quod uirginis nostre marie dignissimis precibus idem ihesus suus filius nobis prestare dignetur Qui cum patre et spiritu sancto viuit et regnat per infinita secula seculorum. Amen.

msItem.title: List of rubrics to Revelations, Books I-VIII
msItem.rubric: HVius libri effectus sumarii capitulariter et brevissime recollecti.
msItem.incipit: In prologo continetur. Quorum sunt inexcusabilies que respuunt huiusdem reuelacionem et ammonicionem diuinam?
msItem.explicit: Correptio informatio et commentacio ad regem suecie contines plura ualde notanda cxxxix et xl capitulis

msItem.title: Prologue to the Revelations
msItem.rubric: Incipit prologus Super libros Revelacionum Sancte Brigitte cum reuelacionibus approbatis
msItem.incipit: STupor et mirabilia audita sunt in terra nostra
msItem.explicit: Sextum est plurium conuersio magnatorum in regno qui tempore et loco una uoce cordis sui mocionem in melius experti nisi ingrati fuerint a christo? ab eo factam ad uerba eius ab eo missa fatebuntur

msItem.title: Revelations, Book 1
msItem.rubric: Incipit primus liber reuelacionum celestium domine brigitte de suecia rubrica primi capituli
msItem.incipit: Verba domini nostri ihesu christi ad suam electam sponsam
msItem.explicit: Attamen verba mea sine voluntate eorum conplebuntur et quasi artabunt se ad perfeccionem usque quo veniant ad locum qui mihi placuerit

msItem.title: Revelations, Book 2
msItem.explicit: Utrum autem ipse est in inferno uel in purgatorio non est tibi licitum scire sed cum tempus fuerit tibi loquendi

msItem.title: Revelations, Book 3
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber tercius reuelacionum sancte brigitte
msItem.incipit: Ihesus christus deus et homo qui uenit ad terram sumere humanitatem et saluare animas sanguine suo qui uiam ueram illuminauit aperuitque portam celi ipse me misit ad uos audi tu qui (postea del. scr.) cui datum est spiritualia audire si episcopus ille proponuit et cetera Require in capitulo xxivi:o libri quarti tertia capitula que libro desuunt. Capitulum primum. Mater loquebatur ad sponsam filii dicens Tu ploras
msItem.explicit: Ergo anima que in digito dei esse debet debet extendi per malleum discrecionis et purificacionis corpus uero non interfici sed mundari per abstinenciam et uerba dei per illud diffundantur
msItem.note: After the first sex lines the three first chapters are missing. Capitulum primum in the text corresponds to chapter 4.

msItem.title: Revelations, Book 4
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber quartus reuelacionum sancte Brigitte
msItem.incipit: Apparuit sponse persona quedam hominis cuius crines uidebantur circumscisi cum obprobrio corpus perunctum erat oleo totumque nudatum sed nichil erubescens
msItem.explicit: qui cotidie festinanter appropinquant gracie et visioni maiestatis dei omnipotentis Sequitur quintus liber

msItem.title: Revelations, Book 5
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber quintus reuelacionum Sancte brigitte
msItem.incipit: INcipit quintus liber celestium reuelacionum christi ad beatam brigittam de regno suecie
msItem.explicit: Itaque cum veneris ad ista loca ostendam tibi plura

msItem.title: Revelations, Book 6
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber Sextus Reuelacionum sancte Brigitte
msItem.incipit: mAter dei loquitur ad sponsam dicens Ego sum regina celi
msItem.explicit: alioquin labor suus siperuacuus et oraciones sue erunt minus ad coronam

msItem.title: Revelations, Book 7
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber septimus Reuelacionum Sancte Brigitte
msItem.incipit: Capitulum primum. CUm esset in Roma Beata Brigitta sponsa christi et quadam uice oracioni vacaret cepit cogitare de partu virginis et de illa summa Bonitate dei
msItem.explicit: dicta vero missa et sacramentis susceptis cum maxima deuocione et reuerencia inter manus predictarum personarum emisit spiritum

msItem.title: Revelations, Book 8
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber octauus Reuelacionum sancte Brigitte
msItem.incipit: SUmmus Imperator christus per sponsam loquitur ad reges ostendens se esse verum
msItem.explicit: et colligant pauperes lauentque humiliter pedes eorum.

note.p: Most of chapter 1 missing and a few lines of chapter 2. Book 8 ends with chapter 57, last chapter missing.
: Two short additions in German and Latin:

p.quote: Quid deus §Got ist icht got ist micht . . . dass got unbekant ist. hec beatus Augustinus episcopus et doctor egregius.
§Novum pulcrum exemplum de monacho sancti benedicti. Retulit nobis nuper abbas . . . atque conpassio sepe miraculorum gloria remunerantur

msItem.colophon: Expliciunt Revelaciones approbate Sancte Brigitte per manus Iohannis de Gotha Affinitus est iste liber anno domini Millesimo Quadringentesimo vicesimo quarto sexta feria post festum assumpcionis beate marie. Luckart. Orate pro scriptore omnes

watermark.note: bull’s head with eyes, cross in double contour above, very similar to WZMA www.ksbm.oeaw.ac.at/WZMA/?nr=AT6200-MC14_151, first quarter of the 15th century

p.note: blackamoor with headband (one end of noose), cf WZMA http://www.ksbm.oeaw.ac.at/WZMA/?nr=AT5000-993_27, Vicenza 1419 or 1420

supportDesc.foliation: Contemporary foliation with Roman numerals in ink, i-cxi; after that modern foliation in pencil . Before scattered modern foliation in pencil and in black ink. Error in foliation after XXIIv: instead of XXIII the page is foliated as XXVI. No gap in the text.

p.note: Title and owner mark Bibl. Bülov. Beyern. G. H. Schr. in black ink by a modern hand. A 67 in pencil in top right corner.
Maniculae and marginal notes by different medieval hands. Some of the notes are chapter heading, other appear to be corrections and reactions on the text.
Chapter headings in red in the margin.
A longer addition in the top and outer margin.

decoDesc.p: : Decorative pen drawing and two portraits of monks. The first under the colophon with the name Luckart written above and the second in the outer margin. The second drawing has the text bruder lynkauff written above it.
decoDesc.decoNote: Four 5-14-line initials with reserved lines on the stems, in red as well as in red and brown ink at the beginning of the major texts; 3-4-line plain red initials with simple pen-drawn decoration, some only touched in red; initials in black ink; initials outlined in red crayon; empty spaces left for initials.
